content: Now when the seventh month came, and the sons of Israel  in the cities, the people gathered together as one person to Jerusalem.

Then Jeshua the son of Jozadak and his brothers the priests, and Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel and his brothers, rose up and built the altar of the God of Israel to offer burnt offerings on it, as it is written in the Law of Moses, the man of God.
So they set up the altar on its foundation, because they were terrified of the peoples of the lands; and they offered burnt offerings on it to the , burnt offerings morning and evening.
They also celebrated the Feast of Booths, as it is written, and  the prescribed number of burnt offerings daily, according to the ordinance, as each day required;
and afterward  a continual burnt offering, also for the new moons and for all the appointed festivals of the  that were consecrated, and from everyone who offered a voluntary offering to the .
From the first day of the seventh month they began to offer burnt offerings to the , but the foundation of the temple of the  had not been laid.

Then they gave money to the masons and carpenters, and food, drink, and oil to the Sidonians and the Tyrians to bring cedar wood from Lebanon to the sea at Joppa, according to the permission they had from Cyrus king of Persia.

Now in the second year of their coming to the house of God at Jerusalem, in the second month, Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and the rest of their brothers the priests and the Levites, and all who came from the captivity to Jerusalem, began  and appointed the Levites who were twenty years old and upward to oversee the work of the house of the .
Then Jeshua  his sons and brothers stood united  Kadmiel and his sons, the sons of Judah  the sons of Henadad  their sons and brothers the Levites, to oversee the workmen in the temple of God.

Now when the builders had laid the foundation of the temple of the , the priests stood in their apparel with trumpets, and the Levites, the sons of Asaph, with cymbals, to praise the  according to the directions of King David of Israel.

And they sang, praising and giving thanks to the , , “For  good, for His favor  upon Israel forever.” And all the people shouted with a great shout of joy when they praised the , because the foundation of the house of the  was laid.

Yet many of the priests and Levites and heads of fathers’ , the old men who had seen the first temple, wept with a loud voice when the foundation of this house was laid before their eyes, while many shouted aloud for joy,

so that the people could not distinguish the sound of the shout of joy from the sound of the weeping of the people, because the people were shouting with a loud shout, and the sound was heard far away.
